Memory< Element > Class Template Reference

#include <memory.hpp>

Detailed Description

template<typename Element>
class Memory< Element >

An interface to the memory (de)allocation functions.

Template Parameters:
ElementThe type of the element(s) to (de)allocate.

 Allocate memory.
static void deallocate (Element *memory, Size capacity=1)
 Deallocate memory.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename Element >
static Element* Memory< Element >::allocate ( Size  capacity = 1) [static]

Allocate memory.

Allocate memory to hold a number of Elements.

Parameters:
capacityThe number of Elements, or one when omitted.
Returns:
A pointer to the allocated memory.
Warning:
This does not construct the element(s). Use the placement new operator to do it yourself: 
 Thing * t = Memory<Thing>::allocate();
 new (t) Thing();

Definition at line 48 of file memory.hpp.

template<typename Element >
static void Memory< Element >::deallocate ( Element *  memory,
Size  capacity = 1 
) [static]

Deallocate memory.

Deallocate memory previously allocated by Memory::allocate.

Parameters:
memoryA pointer to the to be deallocated memory.
capacityThe number of elements that were allocated by Memory::allocate, or one when omitted.
Warning:
This does not deconstruct the element(s). You have to call the deconstructor(s) yourself: 
 t->~Thing();
 Memory<Thing>::deallocate(t);
